If you need more help, check out this guide:
Welcome to Manga2Kindle!\nTo use the app we need to configure a few things, let\'s start!
First you\'ll need to authorize our mail server to send to your kindle device the manga documents:
You can do that from your Amazon\'s Account, search for \"Manage your Content and Devices\" and go to \"Preferences\".
Scroll to \"Personal Documents Settings\" and click \"Add a new authorized e-mail\" then just write ours one:
Your Kindle device has something like an email address to be identified, we need it to send manga to it
You can find it in your Kindle\'s settings, inside \"Your Account\", at the very bottom.
At the bottom of this submenu there is an entry called \"Send-to-Kindle Email\"
click on the first entry, \"Your Account\" (👤)
click on \"All settings\" (⚙) on the right.
A bigger top bar will show
Unlock your kindle, in the top bar on your Home (⌂) there is a \'settings\' button (⚙).
In the last line will show your device email, like: SOMETHING@KINDLE.COM
You need to add the folder (or folders) that contains manga chapters
If you are using an app like Tachiyomi you need to select that folder.
By touching the \"+\" button in the right bottom corner (in the screen under this dialog) a filesystem selector will open.
You need to search the folder we talked before.
Once you added a folder it will start scanning it. It will keep an eye on it and scan it every now and then, a notification will show during scans.
Now then, in the list you will have now the recently added folder. You can touch it to enable/disable it and a long touch to change it\'s name or delete it.
Disabling a folder will make the chapters inside disappear from the Chapter List (the first icon in the bottom menu).
